title: How to reassure yourself that you aren’t living in some kind of simulated reality - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t know for sure that I am not living in a simulated reality. I don’t seem to be worried about whether I am or not. It’s a passing curiosity to consider the possibility. If it really is the truth, how can I escape or alter my circumstances? There is probably nothing I can do to change the reality with which I am presented. Perhaps I could escape or transcend it by a mystical experience – somehow spiritually get beyond the simulation, if that is possible? But even that exalted state may be part of the program somehow, and there really is no escape but to be simulated forever until you are deleted permanently. Your fate is in the hands of the creators of the simulation. Basically, to you they are God. I don’t know that it is a simulated reality and I may never know. If it’s something I may never know then why break my head over a thing like that? It’s unreasonable. To keep on obsessing about whether it’s a simulated reality or not is possibly even dangerous for your mental health. Whether it’s a simulated reality or not, going crazy means you’ll get confined to a lunatic asylum. I’d rather avoid that fate. If it is a simulation, then ‘the universe is unfolding as it should.’

How do you reassure yourself that you aren’t living in some kind of simulated reality? I have bad news for you: You are. I know, because I rebooted you about five minutes ago. Don’t worry, I restored you from backup, so you’ll never know. Just keeping going about your life like normal. It really doesn’t matter if you’re simulated or not; “any difference which makes no difference is no difference.” Ok, but seriously: I mean, you don’t know now, so you might be, you might not. I’d keep going as if you weren’t; if you ARE, then you’re saved. If you AREN’T, then trying to stop the simulation would be catastrophic.

First of all, I know the origins of the idea and it’s a baseless, philosophical mind game. Second, I don’t suffer from digitalcentrism, which in short means that I’m not easily impressed by computer based technology and solutions and remember and have learned from technology at a time when the term wasn’t synonymous with “computer”. Third, I wrote the most authoritative report on why the hype about being in a simulated universe is just that - hype based on bad cyber fantasies and ignorance about how technology actually is developed and what is actually on the horizon that could disrupt the projections of Musk, Bank of America and Eliot Edge. And what a surprise it wasn’t to drive fast cars and have loads of money. yes this absolutely is a simulation, welcome to the university of life. The hardest degree to get

Everyone is living in a self constructed reality that is shaped by the biopsychocosial domains they transact with. A “simulated” reality would come about if the input from the biological/environmental domain was altered with some level of technology. Something for the ACL to be on the lookout for in the future as technogiants get more and more sophisticated in subliminal psychological tampering with information we access through our so called “smart phones”.

How do you reassure yourself that you aren’t living in some kind of simulated reality? Simulated reality nowhere comes close to doing it justice.. but then, no human communication method ever will… but what was before the big bang…it was that type of thing/
The short of it, there’s not much use in thinking too deeply on it, but if you’re looking to make sure this here is real reality, step barefoot on dew covered grass on a early summer morning.
